definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
semifeudal and semicolonial (the official Marxist description of China in the late Qing and under the Guomindang)
pinyin: ban4 feng1 jian4 ban4 zhi2 min2 di4

sentences.english: After the Opium War of 1840 -1842, China slowly became semi - colonial and semi - feudal society country.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，中国逐渐沦为半殖民地半封建国家。

sentences.english: China in modern history was a semi-colonial and semi- feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 近代中国是一个半殖民地半封建的社会。

sentences.english: Great State Boxer Protocol shame, become a semi-feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 辛丑条约国大耻，社会沦为半封建。

sentences.english: The securities market in modern China was born in semi-colonial and semi-feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 近代中国证券市场诞生于半殖民地半封建社会。

sentences.english: After the Opium War broke out in 1840, China was reduced to a semi-colonial and semi-feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 年鸦片战争后，中国逐渐沦为半殖民地半封建的社会。

sentences.english: After the Opium War, China was gradually reduced to semifeudal and semicolonial society.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，中国逐步沦为半封建半殖民地社会。

sentences.english: The modern society of China was a semi-feudal and semi-colonial society. How could it realize modernization?
sentences.chinese: 中国近代是个半封建半殖民地社会，如何走向现代化？

sentences.english: Old China was a semifeudal and semicolonial country.
sentences.chinese: 旧中国是一个半封建半殖民地国家。

definition: semifeudal and semicolonial (the official Marxist description of China in the late Qing and under the Guomindang)
pinyin: ban4 feng1 jian4 ban4 zhi2 min2 di4

definition: natural economy (exchange of goods by bartering not involving money)
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
